intro: Dicoma diacanthoides, commonly known as the woolly dandelion, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that helps reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellow flower heads that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seeds dispersed by the wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and extreme temperatures. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
